questions.text: A 26-Year-old G2P1 comes to the OPD for her antenatal visit. USG was performed, and it showed the following features. All of the following are done except:

options.label: A
options.text: The digital cervical examination is done every visit.

options.label: D
options.text: Iron therapy is to be increased to the extent of 100-200 mg/day

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Use of tocolytics The USG (Transvaginal USG-IOC) shows Lambda /Twin Peak sign. The diagnosis is Dichorionic Diamniotic Twins. The use of prophylactic tocolytics such as Terbutaline has shown warning maternal side effects . So it’s not indicated.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. A digital cervical examination should be done every visit to screen for cervical dilation. Option: B. Since its DCDA USG scan should be done every 6 weeks. Option: D. Iron therapy to be increased to 100-200mg/day.

questions.text: A 25-Year-old primi with a twin pregnancy at 36 weeks come with labor pain. Abdominal and USG reveals breech presentation of the 1st twin. What is the next best step of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Internal podalic version followed by breech extraction

questions.explanation:
Solution:

C- Section Mode of delivery in Twin Pregnancy usually depends upon the p resentation and lie of the 1st Twin.

Extraedge:

Vaginal delivery of 2nd twin is not indicated as it may lead to interlocking of twins.

questions.text: A 26yr old primigravida with IVF and twin gestation of 37weeks presents with a history of pain in the abdomen and contractions. She has no comorbidities. Her previous lab investigations and usg are normal. On examination, P-84/min, BP-126/84mmHg, RR-12/min, afebrile, saturation normal, pallor +. Abdominal examination shows fundus just below xiphisternum, multiple fetal parts felt, FHR1-136/min, FHR2-142/min. PV examination shows cervix soft, effaced, 2cm dilated, 2.5cm long, membranes intact, head felt at station 0, show+. The indications for Cesarean section in such patient are- Breech presentation of second twin Conjoined twins Mono amniotic twins Monochorionic twins with TTTS Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2, 3 and 4 The given clinical scenario is that of twin gestation after IVF technique.

Highyeild:

The indications for Cesarean section For twins: Both the fetuses or even the first fetus with noncephalic (breech or transverse) presentation Twins with complications: IUGR, conjoined twins Monoamniotic twins Monochorionic twins with TTTS Collision of both the heads at brim preventing engagement of either head. Point 1) is wrong as non cephalic presentation of both the twins or first twin is an indication for Cesarean section. Breech presentation of one twin means the presentation of other twin could be cephalic or breech or transverse. And the presentation of first fetus isn’t properly mentioned. Hence it cannot be considered as an indication. All the other points are indications.

questions.text: A 28-Year-old presents comes to the OPD at her 2nd trimester for regular antenatal checkup. Her previous USG scan shows the following Image. Now the present sonographic findings suggest Twin to Twin Transfusion Syndrome and shows fetal demise. What would be Quintero Staging?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Stage 5 The previous USG finding shows T- Sign . Diagnosis – Monochorionic Diamniotic Twin . Twin to Twin Transfusion syndrome is most commonly seen in this condition. Quintero Staging System 1999 is usually done once identified TTTS. Here fetal demise is identified.

questions.text: A 28-Year-old primi with twin pregnancy comes with severe labor pain at 36 completed weeks. On Examination the first twin is vertex presentation. All of the following regarding the management are true except.

options.label: A
options.text: Usage of analgesic drug is limited

options.label: B
options.text: Internal examination is not be done soon after the rupture of membranes

options.label: D
options.text: Neonatologist should be present at the time of delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. Internal examination is not be done soon after the rupture of membranes
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Internal examination is not be done soon after the rupture of membranes Internal examination is usually done after the rupture of the membranes to rule out cord prolapsed.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A . Usage of analgesics is limited as the fetus is small and rapid delivery may occur. Option: C. Vaginal delivery is allowed whenever One/Both fetus are in Vertex Presentation. Option: D. Neonatologist should be present to handle out emergencies.

questions.text: A 30-Year-old presents comes to the OPD at her 2nd trimester for regular antenatal checkup. Her previous USG shows T Sign. Now the present sonographic findings suggest Twin to Twin Transfusion Syndrome and shows frank ascites in one of the fetus. What would be Quintero Staging?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Stage 4 The previous USG finding shows T- Sign . Diagnosis – Monochorionic Diamniotic Twin. Twin to Twin Transfusion syndrome is most commonly seen in this condition. Quintero Staging System 1999 is usually done once identified TTTS. Here frank ascites of one fetus is seen.

questions.text: A 30-Year-old primigravida with twin pregnancy. Her 2nd trimester Transvaginal USG shows T sign. She came back now after 6 weeks for her antenatal visit. Doppler revealed only one fetal heart sound. Her USG present showed viability of only one fetus. Using the sonographic method volume of the normal fetus is smaller when compared to the other fetus. What is the next line of management?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Radio Frequency Ablation The diagnosis is twin reversed-arterial-perfusion or Acardia . Usually the volume of the acardiac twin is assessed.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. When the volume is lesser than functioning fetus, deliver at 37 weeks. Option: B. Not usually done. Option: C. If the Volume of blood in the acardiac twin is larger (that is more than 50%) then Radio Frequency Ablation is the preferred modality of therapy.

questions.text: A 30-Year-old woman G2P1 comes to the OPD for her regular antenatal checkup. Her USG finding is shown below. Which of the following statements are false regarding the management:

options.label: B
options.text: Expected management should be taken for post-term birth

options.label: C
options.text: On continuing the pregnancy there is must be closed surveillance to prevent perinatal loss

options.label: D
options.text: There is an increased risk for hemorrhage, thyrotoxicosis

questions.correct_answer: B. Expected management should be taken for post-term birth
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Expected management should be taken for post-term birth

Random:

Explanation For other Options:- Option: A. Termination of pregnancy is often done. But pregnancy continuation is practicing now days . Option: C. Close surveillance is needed for those continuing the pregnancy. Complications result in preterm birth with its attendant adverse perinatal sequelae as well as perinatal loss. Option: D. complications of expectant management include vaginal bleeding, hyperemesis gravidarum, thyrotoxicosis, and early-onset preeclampsia.

questions.text: A 35-Year-old G5P4L4 comes to OPD at 20w POG. There is h/o PCOS for which she is on treatment. There are increased fetal movements on examination, the fundal height is more than POG. Which of the following statement is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Twin peak sign may be seen on USG

questions.explanation:
Solution:

α-fetoprotein is reduced It is a case of twin pregnancy.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Twin peak sign may be seen on USG. It is a true statement. Twin peak sign/λ: - in diamniotic dichorionic twin on USG T sign: - monochorionic diamniotic twins. Option: C. Preterm labor is a complication It is a true statement. Option: D. Increased incidence of megaloblastic anemia This is true statement. Anemia is more due to increased iron and folic acid requirement by 2 fetuses. Deficiency of folic acid leads to increased incidence of megaloblastic anemia.

Extraedge:

Maternal serum gonadotropin, α-fetoprotein and unconjugated estriol are approximately double than those of singleton pregnancy.

questions.text: All are fetal complication in twin pregnancy except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Post Term Pregnancy Post Term Pregnancy is not a complication of the fetus. Fetal Complications in twin pregnancy include:

Highyeild:

Prematurity IUGRQ Single fetal demise Monochorionic monoamniotic twins Twin-twin transfusion syndrome Vanishing twin and abortion Congenital anomalies including acardiac fetus and conjoined twins PROM and cord prolapse Abruption in the second twin Interlocking of twins (extremely rare)

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding Dichorionic Diamniotic twin except:

options.label: A
options.text: Twin Peak / Lambda sign will be suggestive sonographic finding

options.label: C
options.text: 4 intervening membranes in between the twins

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Always same sex Twin peak or lambda sign: It is characteristic of dichorionic pregnancies and is due to the chorionic tissue between the two layers of the intertwin membrane at the placental origin. A potential space exists in the intertwin membrane which is filled by proliferating plancental villi, giving rise to a twin peak sign. Twin peak appears as a triangle with base at chorionic surface and apex in interwin membrane.

Extraedge:

In monochorionic twins there is no chorionic tissue, and interwin membrane is composed of 2 amnion only giving rise to the “T” sign on ultrasound

questions.text: Correct statement about establishing the chorionicity in twin pregnancy is:

options.label: C
options.text: Thick membrane is present in monochorionic

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Twin peak in dichorionicity Chorionicity of the placenta is best diagnosed by ultrasound at 6 to 9 weeks of gestation. In dichorionic twins there is a thick septum between the chorionic sacs. It is best identified at the base of the membrane, where a triangular projection is seen. This is known as lambda or twin peak sign. Presence of lambda or twin peak sign indicates dichorionic placenta So it is clear that lambda/Twin peak sign clearly indicates dichorionic placenta.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A: Same sex rules out dichorionicity, this is incorrect because— Twins of opposite sex are almost always dizygotic dichorionic but same sex does not rule out dichorionicity. Option C: Thick membrane is present in monochorionic twins This is also incorrect because monochorionic means there is a single chorion whereas dichorionic means there are 2 chorions so obviously dichorionic membrane will be thick . Option D: Chronicity is best detected after 16 weeks.

Extraedge:

Monochorionic pregnancies have a dividing membrane that is so thin, it may not be seen until the second trimester. The membrane is generally less than 2mm thick and magnification reveals only 2 layers (of amnion) The best time to detect chrorionicity by USG is between 6 to 9 weeks.

questions.text: Embryo reduction of multiple pregnancy is done at:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

11–13 weeks Selective reduction: If there are 4 or more fetuses, selective reduction of the fetuses leaving behind only two is done to improve outcome of the co fetuses. This can be done by intracardiac injection of potassium chloride between 11 and 13weeks under ultrasonic guidance using a 22 gauge needle . It is done transabdominally. Umbilical cord of the targeted twin is occluded by fetoscopic ligation or by laser or by bipolar coagulation, to protect the co twin from adverse drug effect. Multiple pregnancy reduction improves perinatal outcome in women with triplets or more. Risk of miscarriage = 5-7%.

Extraedge:

Selective termination of a fetus with structural or genetic abnormality may be done in dichorionic multiple pregnancy in the second trimester.

questions.text: False statement regarding conjoint twins.

options.label: A
options.text: Craniopagus is the most common variety

options.label: C
options.text: During sonographic evaluation, relative position of Fetal Poles doesn’t change

questions.correct_answer: A. Craniopagus is the most common variety
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Craniopagus is the most common variety Thoracopagus is the Most Common Variety.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: B. Viable conjoint twins are delivered by C-Section. Option: C. During sonographic evaluation, relative position of Fetal Poles doesn’t change. They lie at the same plane. Option: D. These are MCMA twins . Other- Craniopagus is the worst prognosis.

questions.text: False statement regarding TTTS?

options.label: C
options.text: Definitive management is Fetoscopic Laser Ablation

options.label: D
options.text: Kernicterus may develop in recipient twin

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Seen in DCDA It is seen in MCDA Twins.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: B. Donor twin is anemic and recipient twin is polycythemic. Option: C. Definitive management is Fetoscopic Laser Ablation. Option: D. In recipient Twin.

questions.text: In superfecundation which of the following is seen:

options.label: A
options.text: Fertilization of 2 ova released at same time, by sperms released at intercourse on 2 different occasions

options.label: B
options.text: Fertilization of 2 ova released at same time by sperms released at single intercourse

questions.correct_answer: A. Fertilization of 2 ova released at same time, by sperms released at intercourse on 2 different occasions
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Fertilization of 2 ova released at same time, by sperms released at intercourse on 2 different occasions Superfecundation It is the fertilization of two different ova released in the same cycle , by separate acts of coitus within a short period of time. Superfetation It is the fertilization of two ova released in different menstrual cycles .

Extraedge:

This is theoretically possible until the decidual space is obliterated by 12 weeks of pregnancy.

questions.text: Indications of urgent delivery of the second baby in twin are all except:

options.label: B
options.text: Cord prolapse of the second baby

options.label: C
options.text: Inadvertent use of IV ergometrine with the delivery of the anterior shoulder of the first baby

options.label: D
options.text: Breech presentation of the second baby

questions.correct_answer: D. Breech presentation of the second baby
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Breech presentation of the second baby But there are some conditions in which urgent delivery of the second baby is required – Indications of urgent delivery of the second baby: Severe (intrapartum) vaginal bleeding Cord prolapse of the second baby Inadvertent use of intravenous ergometrine with the delivery of the anterior shoulder of the first baby First baby delivered under general anesthesia Appearance of fetal distress. Management: In all these conditions, the baby should be delivered quickly. A rational scheme is given below which depends on the lie, presentation and station of the head.

Highyeild:

Head If low down, delivery by forceps If high up, delivery by internal version under general anesthesia.

Extraedge:

Breech should be delivered by breech extraction Transverse lie - internal podalic version followed by breech extraction under general anesthesia.

questions.text: Match the following twin gestation with the duration of division accordingly
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1=d, 2=c, 3=a, 4=b Simultaneous development of two fetuses in the uterus is the most common variety of multiple pregnancy.

Highyeild:

Dizygotic (75%) Monozygotic (25%) Arising from fertilisation of two ova by different spermatozoa They arise from splitting of single fertilized ovum and hence are always of the same sex and look like.

questions.text: Not a risk factor for dizygotic twinning?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Early primi Usually advancing age of the mother (Between 30-35 and above).

Highyeild:

Other factors responsible for twinning: Race- Negroes Procedures like ART/IVF Increases with increase in pariety especially from 5th gravid onward

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Positive family history especially more transmitted through maternal side. Option: B. Obesity is also considered a risk factor. Option: D. Drugs like clomiphene citrate (5-6%).

questions.text: Vaginal delivery is allowed in all except:

options.label: B
options.text: First twin cephalic and second breech

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Monochorionic monoamniotic twins

Highyeild:

In Monochorionic monoamniotic presentations the twins share a single amniotic sac and placate so there is almost a 50% incidence of cord accidents and that is one reason which even prompts to do a preterm cesarean to many practitioners to avoid a sudden fetal cord entrapment and fetal death. A situation requiring cesarean delivery in twin pregnancy is a monoamniotic placentation. The fetal mortality in these pregnancies is greater than 50% and the overwhelming cause is cord accidents such as cord prolapse or entanglement.

Extraedge:

In twins, the chances of vaginal delivery are high if the first twin or presenting twin is cephalic. Extended breech is the commonest breech presentation and is also the best possible presentation for a normal vaginal delivery in breech.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the given image is false

options.label: C
options.text: The fetus alive and has no problems in the postnatal life

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All are false This is a case of fetus papyraceus This is because all the three options are wrong statements.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. More common in dizygotic twins This is a false statement It may occur in both types of twins But it is more common in monozygotic twins Option: B. Cannot be detected by USG This is a false statement It may be diagnosed at the time of delivery or during pregnancy by USG. Option: C. The fetus is alive and has no problem in the postnatal life. This is a false statement. The fetus is dead The dead fetus is flattened, mummified and compressed between the membranes of the live fetus and the uterine wall.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about twinning is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The frequencies of monozygosity and dizygosity are the same

options.label: B
options.text: Division after formation of the embryonic disk result in conjoined twins

options.label: C
options.text: The incidence of monozygotic twinning varies with race

options.label: D
options.text: A dichorionic twin pregnancy always denotes dizygosity

questions.correct_answer: B. Division after formation of the embryonic disk result in conjoined twins
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Division after formation of the embryonic disk result in conjoined twins

Highyeild:

In twin pregnancies : there is a higher risk of low birth weight babies and preterm labor . Multiple pregnancies are commonly associated with moderate to severe anemia, gestational hypertension, malpresentation, polyhydramnios, cord prolapse, abruption or placenta previa in mother.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A: Frequency of MZ and DZ twins is not same , DZ twins are more common. Option C: The incidence of MZ remains same throughout the would (1 in 250 pregnancies) whereas incidence of DZ twins varies with race. Option D: DZ twins are always dichorionic but MZ twins can either be monochorionic on dichorionic. IT is incorrect to say dichorionic twins one always dizygotic.
